page.title: 02Settlements and housing
page.content: There are six large farms in the area keeping cattle and sheep ranging in size from about 100 to 500 acres,but a few small holdings are only about 20 acres-here the people have other jobs as well.There are some cottages lived in by people working in towns and also about 20 holiday homes which are empty for most of the year.Most houses are old. The village of Whitton has about 12 houses and a small post office.Four of the houses are council houses and one was built by the Forestry Commission.There are no shops in Whitton and no modern houses - the new est is about 30years old.A lot of the land is owned by the Dame Anna Child's Charity which helps pay for the village school and this has stopped a lot of building in the area-lots of other villages round here have new houses.
